title: Rising Inflation Expectations, Hawkish Fed Prompted Larger Bank of Mexico Rate Increase, Minutes Show
sub_head: The central bank raised its policy interest rate by a half percentage point to 5.5% at Dec. 16 meeting
body:
MEXICO CITY—A pickup in inflation to a 20-year high, rising inflation expectations and prospects of a more restrictive U.S. Federal Reserve prompted the Bank of Mexico to speed up the pace of interest-rate increases in December, minutes of the bank’s meeting last month showed Thursday.
The Bank of Mexico’s five-member board voted 4-1 on Dec. 16 to raise the overnight interest-rate target by a half percentage point to 5.5%, following four consecutive quarter-point increases since June.
